ETYMOLOGY: From Latin Iūlius, the name given to the month of Quintilis (the fifth month of the original Roman calendar) in honor of Julius Caesar, who was born in that month.
SINCE: 44 BC (renaming of the month); 13th century (English usage)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Proper Noun: A specific name for a person, place, or thing.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The seventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, immediately following June and preceding August, having 31 days.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 格里高利历法中一年的第七个月，在六月之后，八月之前，共有31天。通常是北半球的盛夏。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The summer holidays typically begin in July.
